content: विवेकः {@--1@} Discrimination, judgment, discernment, discretion; काश्यपि यातस्तवापि च विवेकः <ls>Bv. 1. 68</ls>, <ls n="Bv. 1.">66</ls>; ज्ञातोयं जलधर तावको विवेकः <ls n="Bv. 1.">96</ls>; विवेकभ्रष्टानां भवति विनितः शतमुखः <ls>Bh. 2. 10.</ls> {@--2@} Consideration, discussion, investigation; यच्छृगारविवेकतत्त्वमपि यत्काव्येषु लीलायित <ls>Gīt. 12</ls>, so द्वैत,° धर्म° {@--3@} Distinction, difference, discriminating (between two things); नीरक्षीरविवेके हंसालस्यं त्वमेव तनुषे चेत् <ls>Bv. 1. 13</ls>; <ls>Bk. 17. 60.</ls> {@--4@} (In Vedānta <ab>phil.</ab>) The power of distinguishing between the visible world and the invisible spirit, or of separating reality from mere semblance or illusion. {@--5@} True knowledge. {@--6@} A receptacle for water, basin, reservoir.
